bibl.title: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, January 17, 1951

div1.p: Siler sends Hench photographs of the plaque placed on the building where Reed died. He congratulates Hench for being awarded the Nobel prize and hopes that he will be able to attend this year's Walter Reed Memorial Association meeting.

div1.head: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, January 17, 1951
div1.opener:
GORGAS MEMORIAL INSTITUTE
OF
TROPICAL AND PREVENTIVE MEDICINE
INCORPORATED
----
GORGAS MEMORIAL LABORATORY
EXECUTIVE OFFICES
1835 EYE STREET, NORTHWEST
WASHINGTON 6, D. C.
January 17, 1951
JOSEPH F. SILER
PRESIDENT
MAURICE H. THATCHER
VICE PRESIDENT AND GENERAL COUNSEL
WALTER A. BLOEDORN
SECRETARY
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
A few days ago General De Coursey, Head of the Armed
Forces Institute of Pathology, was good enough to send his photo-
grapher out to Ft. Lesley J. McNair to take some pictures of the
Walter Reed plaque that was placed there last spring. The camera
man took several photographs and I am enclosing herewith a print of
each of the four taken.

I would appreciate it very much if you would give us
your opinion as to the best one for reproduction and distribution
to members of the Walter Reed Board of Managers. There is a number
on the back of each print and if you will just refer to the number
in replying, there will be no need of returning the prints.

May I congratulate you again on the Nobel Prize Award
which was so highly deserved. I hope that since your return to this
country you have been able to reduce some of your many activities so
that you are able to get some rest.

We sent you recently a copy of the minutes of the
annual meeting of the Walter Reed group. I hope that it will be pos-
sible for you to attend the next meeting in November of this year.

We hear from Mrs. Kean frequently and she seems to be
all right although just recovered from an upper respiratory infection.

With kindest regards and very best wishes for the New
Year,

closer.signed:
J. F. Siler
Col., (MC), USA, Rtd.
